terms.definition: Help Authoring Tool - specialized software that helps technical writers create, edit, and publish documentation across multiple formats and platforms
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Content Management System - a software platform that allows users to create, manage, and modify digital content without needing specialized technical knowledge
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and collaborate safely
An authentication process that allows users to access multiple applications or systems with one set of login credentials
A documentation approach where content is broken down into small, reusable pieces or topics that can be combined into different publications
An automated feature that translates content from one language to another without manual intervention
A personalized web address that represents a brand or organization, rather than using a generic platform URL
Secure Sockets Layer - a security protocol that encrypts data transmitted between a web server and browser to protect sensitive information
Assistance provided to transfer existing content, data, or systems from one platform to another
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit and see changes in a document as they happen
Large-scale software applications designed to meet the complex needs of organizations rather than individual users
Information resources that allow users to find answers and solve problems independently without contacting support
Data and insights about how users interact with documentation, including views, searches, and engagement metrics
Instructional materials designed to help new users or employees learn how to use a product or system effectively
